member.name: M:InstaSharp.Endpoints.InstagramApi.#ctor(System.String,InstaSharp.InstagramConfig,InstaSharp.Models.Responses.OAuthResponse)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The endpoint.
The instagram configuration.
The oauth response.

members.member:
You can help us better identify API calls from your app by making server-side calls with a HTTP header named X-Insta-Forwarded-For signed using your Client Secret. This header is optional, but recommended for any app making server-to-server calls. To enable this setting, edit your OAuth Client configuration and mark the Enforce signed header checkbox. When enabled, Instagram will check for the X-Insta-Forwarded-For HTTP header and verify its signature. HMAC signed using the SHA256 hash algorithm with your client's IP address and Client Secret.
TODO: only public for unit testing purposes. Move to another class?

member.name: P:InstaSharp.Endpoints.InstagramApi.Ips
member.summary: IP information: Comma-separated list of one or more IPs; if your app receives requests directly from clients, then it should be the client's remote IP as detected by the your app's load balancer; if your app is behind another load balancer (for example, Amazon's ELB), this should contain the exact contents of the original X-Forwarded-For header. You can use the 127.0.0.1 loopback address during testing

member.name: P:InstaSharp.Endpoints.InstagramApi.EnforceSignedHeader
member.summary: Requires the use of your Client Secret to sign POST and DELETE API requests. Use this option to instruct Instagram to check requests for the 'X-Insta-Forwarded-For' HTTP header. Eligible requests that do not provide this header and a valid signature will fail. This technique helps identify you as the legitimate owner of this OAuth Client. Only enable this option for server-to-server calls. See the Restrict API Requests documentation for details. http://instagram.com/developer/restrict-api-requests/ This needs to be configured at application level

member.summary:
Get a full list of comments on a media.

member.name: M:InstaSharp.Endpoints.Comments.Post(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Create a comment on a media. Please email apidevelopers[at]instagram.com for access.
Requires Authentication: True
Required Scope: comments
member.param: The id of the media on which to post a comment.
Text to post as a comment on the media as specified in media-id.

member.name: M:InstaSharp.Endpoints.Comments.Delete(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Remove a comment either on the authenticated user's media or authored by the authenticated user.
Requires Authentication: True
Required Scope: comments
member.param: The id of the media from which to delete the comment.
The id of the comment to delete.

member.name: M:InstaSharp.Endpoints.Geographies.Recent(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Get very recent media from a geography subscription that you created. Note: you can only access Geographies that were explicitly created by your OAuth client. To backfill photos from the location covered by this geography, use the media search endpoint.
Requires Authentication: False
member.param: The id of the media about which to retrieve data

member.summary:

Requires Authentication: False
member.param: The id of the media about which to retrieve data
Max number of media to return.
Return media before this min_id.

member.name: M:InstaSharp.Endpoints.Tags.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Get information about a tag object.
member.param: Return information about this tag.

member.name: M:InstaSharp.Endpoints.Tags.Recent(System.String)
member.summary: Get a list of recently tagged media. Note that this media is ordered by when the media was tagged with this tag, rather than the order it was posted. Use the max_tag_id and min_tag_id parameters in the pagination response to paginate through these objects.
member.param: Return information about this tag.

member.name: M:InstaSharp.Endpoints.Tags.Recent(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Get a list of recently tagged media. Note that this media is ordered by when the media was tagged with this tag, rather than the order it was posted. Use the max_tag_id and min_tag_id parameters in the pagination response to paginate through these objects.
member.param: Return information about this tag.
Return media before this min_tag_id. If you don't want to use this parameter, use null.
Return media after this max_tag_id. If you don't want to use this parameter, use null.
Count of tagged media to return. Will still be governed by Instagram's enforced limit.

member.name: M:InstaSharp.Endpoints.Tags.RecentMultiplePages(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String)
member.summary: Gets a list of recently tagged media. Paginates until a predefined limit is reached or the end is reached. Note this could increase your daily limit Check
member.param: Return information about this tag.
Return media [before]after this min_tag_id. If you don't want to use this parameter, use null.
Return media [after] before this max_tag_id. If you don't want to use this parameter, use null.
the number of pages at which you wish to stop returning data. Otherwise it keeps going until the end. Be warned, you could quickly use your daily limit
Doesnt return any data older than or including this id
member.returns: a response object containing a list of the media responses and the last returned Meta code

member.name: M:InstaSharp.Endpoints.Tags.CropDataIfIdFound(System.Collections.Generic.List{InstaSharp.Models.Media},System.String)
member.param: The media id without the _user suffix

member.name: M:InstaSharp.Endpoints.Tags.Search(System.String)
member.summary: Search for tags by name. Results are ordered first as an exact match, then by popularity. Short tags will be treated as exact matches.
member.param: A valid tag name without a leading #. (eg. snowy, nofilter)

member.name: M:InstaSharp.Endpoints.Users.Liked(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary:
See the authenticated user's list of media they've liked. Note that this list is ordered by the order in which the user liked the media. Private media is returned as long as the authenticated user has permission to view that media. Liked media lists are only available for the currently authenticated user.
Requires Authentication: True
member.param: Return media ealier than this maxLikeId.
Count of media to return.
